definition: to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
surname Lu

sentences.english: Tryin' to make His way home.
The earth belongs to anyone who stops for a moment, gazes and goes on his way.
sentences.chinese: 地球屬於那些停留片刻，凝視它，然後繼續趕路的人。

sentences.english: People drive right down a road and never notice an old woman like that.
sentences.chinese: 亻們只顧趕路，從不會注意到那樣一個老。

sentences.english: When they arrived at dryland, the elder went his own way.
sentences.chinese: 當他們到達一片陸地時，老者又獨自趕路了。

sentences.english: Happiness on the road on the regular traffic jam, because too many people.
sentences.chinese: 幸福的大路上經常堵車，因爲趕路的人太多了。

sentences.english: When they arrived at dry land, the elder went his own way.
sentences.chinese: 到達陸地後，長者繼續趕路了。

sentences.english: The caravan traveled by night and day in order to reach their destination on time.
sentences.chinese: 那支商隊披星戴月趕路，以便按時到達目的地。

sentences.english: Right from the beginning, pedestrian A had always been keeping his head low, while rushing somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 一開始路人甲就只是低着頭，匆匆趕路。

sentences.english: These hurrying walkers intended to spend the night in this thatched cottage.
sentences.chinese: 趕路的這幾個人打算就在這個草窩裏過夜了。

sentences.english: The traveller was very angry. "This man must be mad, " he thought, and walked on.
sentences.chinese: 旅行者很惱火，“人準是瘋了，”他想，又趕路了。

sentences.english: And the Rat pressed forward on his way without waiting for an answer.
sentences.chinese: 河鼠不等鼴鼠回答，只顧悶頭向前趕路。

sentences.english: Sometimes we just give up and move on.
sentences.chinese: 有時候我們只好打消了問路的念頭繼續趕路。

sentences.english: They did not seem to be in a hurry, yet they walked faster than I did.
sentences.chinese: 他們好象並不急於趕路，但他們都比我走得快。

sentences.english: A person walking in the street, and then calmly like walking.
sentences.chinese: 一個人走在街上，再從容也像趕路。

sentences.english: A small troop was threading the causeway at a good pace.
sentences.chinese: 一小隊人馬在堤道上急急地趕路。

sentences.english: The tyres bite into the snow and we were on our way.
sentences.chinese: 輪胎在雪地上咬住不打滑，我們繼續趕路。

definition: tired/exhausted/worn out/to toil
beaten/exhausted/tired
to go on a journey/to leave
distant/far-flung
long and difficult trek
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
to shake/to jolt/to bump
to dash (run fast)/to rush/to dart
lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information
to stop
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
to ride (a bicycle, horse, motorbike etc)/cycling/horseback riding/motorbike riding/a ride/CL:次[ci4]
to find a place for/to help settle down/to arrange for/undisturbed/peaceful
to drive a car
lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); a fleeting glance in passing/fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information
